file_id.title: File ID e.g. F1
file_id.description: File to which the variable belongs

vid.title: Variable unique ID
vid.description: Unique variable ID e.g. V1, V2

var_intrvl.title: Interval type
var_intrvl.description: indicates the interval type; options are discrete or continuous.

var_dcml.title: Variable decimal points
var_dcml.description: Number of decimal points in the variable

var_wgt.title: Weight
var_wgt.description: indicates whether the variable is a weight

loc_rec_seg_no.title: Record segment number, deck or card number the variable is located on

var_imputation.title: Imputation
var_imputation.description: According to the Statistical Terminology glossary maintained by the National Science Foundation, this is `the process by which one estimates missing values for items that a survey respondent failed to provide,` and if applicable in this context, it refers to the type of procedure used.

var_derivation.title: Derivation
var_derivation.description: Used only in the case of a derived variable, this element provides both a description of how the derivation was performed and the command used to generate the derived variable, as well as a specification of the other variables in the study used to generate the derivation. The `var` attribute provides the ID values of the other variables in the study used to generate this derived variable.

var_qstn_preqtxt.title: Pre-question text
var_qstn_preqtxt.description: Text describing a set of conditions under which a question might be asked.

var_forward.title: Forward skip
var_forward.description: Contains a reference to IDs of possible following questions. This can be used to document forward skip instructions.

var_backward.title: Backward skip
var_backward.description: Contains a reference to IDs of possible preceding questions. This can be used to document backward skip instructions.

var_sumstat.description:
One or more statistical measures that describe the responses to a particular variable and may include one or more standard summaries, e.g., minimum and maximum values, median, mode, etc. 

 The attribute 'type' denotes the type of statistics being shown: mean, median, mode, valid cases, invalid cases, minimum, maximum, or standard deviation.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type such as frequency, percent, etc

var_std_catgry.title: Standard categories
var_std_catgry.description: Standard category codes used in the variable, like industry codes, employment codes, or social class codes. The attribute `date` is provided to indicate the version of the code in place at the time of the study. The attribute `URI` is provided to indicate a URN or URL that can be used to obtain an electronic list of the category codes.

var_format.title: Variable format
var_format.description: The technical format of the variable in question. Attributes for this element include: 'type', which indicates if the variable is character or numeric; 'formatname,' which in some cases may provide the name of the particular, proprietary format actually used; 'schema,' which identifies the vendor or standards body that defined the format (acceptable choices are SAS, SPSS, IBM, ANSI, ISO, XML-data or other); 'category,' which describes what kind of data the format represents, and includes date, time, currency, or 'other' conceptual possibilities.
